description: This file implements an in-memory paper trading broker for development and testing purposes. It provides methods to place simulated orders, retrieve current positions, and get the profile status, acting as a mock broker interface.

classes.name: PaperBroker
classes.description: A mock implementation of a broker interface that simulates order placement and position tracking for testing without real trading.

methods.name: __init__(self)
methods.description: Initializes the PaperBroker with empty order list and position dictionary.

methods.name: str _gen_order_id(self)
methods.description: Generates a unique in-memory order ID with a 'PAPER-' prefix.

methods.name: OrderResponse place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
methods.description: Simulates placing a trading order, updates in-memory order list and positions, and returns a mock OrderResponse.

methods.name: list[dict] get_positions(self)
methods.description: Returns the current simulated positions as a list of dictionaries.

methods.name: dict get_profile(self)
methods.description: Returns a static profile indicating a simulated 'paper' mode and connection status.

ctags.name: place_order
ctags.pattern: /^    def place_order(self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None) -> Order/
ctags.signature: (self, symbol: str, side: str, qty: int, price: float | None = None)
